docs.lead_paragraph: The nation spends roughly $2.5 trillion every year on health care, nearly a fifth of the American economy. Here is a primer on what the medical establishment stands to lose or gain as Congress engages the issue.

docs.lead_paragraph: JIMMY FALLON Edward Whitaker, the former chairman of AT&T, was appointed the new chairman of General Motors. I'm not sure about his business plan. He's giving away free cars on nights and weekends. I think that's a bad idea.
docs.snippet: JIMMY FALLON     Edward Whitaker, the former chairman of AT&T, was appointed the new chairman of General Motors. I'm not sure about his business plan. He's giving away free cars on nights and weekends. I think that's a bad idea.

docs.lead_paragraph: 10 P.M. (A&E) HAMMERTIME Two decades ago M C Hammer, a k a Stanley Burrell, seemed untouchable. But a few years later Hammer, a three-time Grammy-winning rapper who had sold more than 50 million albums, was rapidly sliding from superstardom into middle-class obscurity. In this new reality series, Mr. Burrell; Stephanie, his wife of 24 years; and their six children, ages 3 to 21, try to revive the Hammer empire from their home in Tracy, Calif. This premiere episode introduces the family as it does spring cleaning and unearths Hammer memorabilia buried deep in a closet. Elsewhere, Mr. Burrell, above center, works with his dance crew and his cousin Marv, who desperately wants to kick it but may not have the moves. At 10:30 Mr. Burrell demonstrates his version of Daddy day care. 9 A.M. (CNN) STATE OF THE UNION WITH JOHN KINGKathleen Sebelius, secretary of health and human services, discusses the fight for a public insurance plan before moving to ''This Week With George Stephanopoulos'' at 10 on ABC.
